definition: abbr. for 眾議院|众议院[Zhong4 yi4 yuan4], House of Representatives
to parade (a prisoner) through the streets
to behead sb and display the head in public

sentences.english: I think that beheading in the market is not a proper policy.
sentences.chinese: 斩首示众这件事，我认为是很有问题的。

sentences.english: The criminals were paraded in chains through the crowded streets.
sentences.chinese: 罪犯带着镣铐被押着列队游街示众。

sentences.english: The captured criminals were paraded through the streets.
sentences.chinese: 抓获的罪犯被游街示众。

sentences.english: The day there was an execution held in the market – a criminal was beheaded.
sentences.chinese: 这一天在市集上，有罪犯被斩首示众。

sentences.english: The captured criminals were paraded through the main streets.
sentences.chinese: 被抓获的犯人列队游街示众。

sentences.english: Sichuan wild bush son command will iron mountain body hang up.
sentences.chinese: 川野希子命令将铁山的尸体挂起来示众。

sentences.english: After left the market, beheading in front of the mass still lingered on Laotse's mind.
sentences.chinese: 离开市集后，斩首示众这一幕仍然停留在老子的心中。

sentences.english: Will those found guilty be dragged straight from the court to the pillory?
sentences.chinese: 那些看起来有罪的人会从法庭上被直接拉出去示众吗？

sentences.english: They were taken from a prayer group at gunpoint and marched to the camp.
sentences.chinese: 他们是被用枪指着头游行示众来到这里的一群基督徒。

definition: to parade (a prisoner) through the streets
to behead sb and display the head in public
to parade sb through the streets/to march or parade in the streets
in order to warn against following bad examples (idiom)/as a warning to others
to hang (i.e. execute by hanging)/to strangle
to bind a person's upper body, with arms tied behind the back and rope looped around the neck/to truss up
an execution/to put sb to death
to beat a prisoner (to obtain confessions)/to give sb the third degree/to torture
